event_description: Apple reported record-breaking Q2 2021 financial results on April 28, 2021. The company posted $89.6 billion in revenue, a 54% increase year-over-year, and $23.6 billion in profit. This performance was driven by strong double-digit growth across all product categories, including iPhone, Mac, and iPad, and record services revenue.

During its Q2 2021 earnings call on April 28, 2021, Apple announced that it expected supply constraints to have a revenue impact of $3 billion to $4 billion in the subsequent June quarter. This was primarily anticipated to affect iPad and Mac sales.
